titles.title: To provide for a reduced rate of postage for certain mailings that, under Federal or State law, are required to be made by local governments.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight.

bill.summary: 9/24/1996--Introduced. Requires the U.S. Postal Service to establish a discount presort first-class postage rate for specified local governmental mailings that are mandated by Federal or State law, such as property tax statements, summonses, and jury-duty pay, but for which no Federal or State funds are provided to local governments to defray the associated administrative costs.
